page.title: 14WILDLIFE OF SHIELDAIG
page.content: THERE IS A VARIETY OF WILDLIFE AROUND SHIELDAIG. LATE AT NIGHT YOU CAN SEE SEA OTTERS AND SOMETIMES A FOX OR WILDCAT. YOU DO NOT SEE THEM OFTEN. THERE ARE A LOT OF BIRDS TOO. YOU CAN SEE SNIPES, CORMORANTS,GREAT-NORTHERN DIVERS AND RED-THROATED DIVERS. THESE ARE ONLY A FEW OF ALL THE BIRDS YOU CAN SEE OR HEAR. THERE ARE A LOT OF SEALS AT RUBH-AN-ROIN, WHICH IS GAELIC FOR 'SEAL POINT'. YOU CAN SOMETIMES SEE THEIR BLACK HEADS WHICH CAN BE MISTAKEN FOR BUOYS. SOMETIMES YOU CAN HEAR THEM BARKING. YOU CAN SEE DEER IN THE WINTER WHEN THEY COME DOWN FROM THE HILLS. ONE RARE ANIMAL WHICH STEALS HENS ARE THE PINE MARTENS WHICH INHABIT THE QUIETER AREAS ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE LOCH.
